caption.p: Malaria life cycle and primary areas of drug activity. The malaria parasite life cycle involves two hosts. During a blood meal, a malaria-infected female mosquito inoculates sporozoites into the human host [ 1]. Sporozoites infect liver cells [ 2] and mature into schizonts [ 3], which rupture and release merozoites [ 4]. Chemoprophylaxis medications either act at the liver stage preventing a blood-stage infection or at the erythrocytic stage of the malaria life cycle.
